abstract: Hao Yeli, former official in one of Chinese military department responsible for offensive electronic warfare, delivers speech at Internet security conference in Beijing that is sharply critical of United States' Internet policy; remarks cloud optimism some analysts had expressed in wake of agreement made between two countries about limiting cyberattacks against one another, and point to vast gulf in how they view technology issues.
lead_paragraph: The official, Hao Yeli, said removing developing countries’ ability to control public opinion through Internet controls and surveillance would not result in more openness.

headline.main: Chinese Official Faults U.S. Internet Security Policy
headline.print_headline: Chinese Official Criticizes U.S. on Internet Security Policy

snippet: The official, Hao Yeli, said removing developing countries’ ability to control public opinion through Internet controls and surveillance would not result in more openness.
